intro: Rudgea venezuelensis, commonly known as the Venezuelan rudgea, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Venezuela. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its ornamental value. The plant typically features showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink, attracting pollinators such as hummingbirds and bees. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in shaded, moist environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
